title: The fs/accounting/stats module fails to function correctly when transfers==1.
body:
The stats counter reseting in accounting/stats.go is triggered when.
The transfer/checker worker counter all is 0.

When transfers=1 is configured, after the checker completes its scan and exits,
the transfer switching triggers this reset condition.

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/b7c6268d3e3f33ab3c6ca2bc0d2f98a60ed72105/fs/accounting/stats.go#L830-L835

This should include a check to see if the transfer queue is empty.

Another related bug: the state management for stats.average
is also broken. The _stopAverageLoop method doesn't reset
the s.average.started flag.


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Transfer speed and ETA time is not update correctly.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.71.0.1
- os/version: darwin 12.7.6 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 21.6.0 (x86_64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
LInux & Mac OSX


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)



#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
rclone copy -Pv --transfers=1 --bwlimit=10m a b
```
